etymologies: late 19th century: from single, on the pattern of simpleton

definitions: a single person or thing of the kind under consideration

examples.text: splitting the clumps of plants into singletons

shortDefinitions: single person or thing of kind under consideration

definitions: a child or animal born singly, rather than one of a multiple birth
shortDefinitions: child or animal born singly, rather than one of multiple birth

definitions: (in card games, especially bridge) a card that is the only one of its suit in a hand

examples.text: declarer drew trumps, finding that West had a singleton

shortDefinitions: in card games card that is only one of its suit in hand

definitions: a set which contains exactly one element

examples.text: Lewis argues that the relation of a singleton to its only member is mysterious

shortDefinitions: set which contains exactly one element
